pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce ThingsGateway, explaining what it is, its core purpose as an industrial IoT gateway, and the high-level architecture

pages.title: Key Features
pages.purpose: List and describe the main features including multi-protocol support, plugin architecture, data persistence options, and deployment models

pages.title: System Requirements and Dependencies
pages.purpose: Document the .NET versions, target frameworks, required NuGet packages, and system requirements

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Provide quick-start guide for installing and running ThingsGateway

pages.title: Installation and Deployment
pages.purpose: Explain deployment options including Docker (x64/ARM64), web server, desktop application, and configuration basics

pages.title: Initial Configuration
pages.purpose: Guide users through initial setup including appsettings.json, environment variables, logging configuration, and first channel/device setup

pages.title: Architecture Overview
pages.purpose: Explain the overall system architecture including layered design, separation of concerns, and component relationships

pages.title: Layered Architecture
pages.purpose: Describe the Foundation, Gateway Application, and UI/Admin layers and their responsibilities

pages.title: Plugin System Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the plugin architecture including Foundation vs Plugin layer separation, dynamic loading with AssemblyLoadContext, and plugin types

pages.title: Build System and Conditional Compilation
pages.purpose: Document the MSBuild-based build system including Directory.Build.props, conditional plugin loading, multi-targeting, and NuGet package generation

pages.title: Foundation Layer
pages.purpose: Document the core foundation libraries that provide protocol implementations and communication primitives

pages.title: Device Communication
pages.purpose: Explain DeviceBase abstraction, IDevice interface, protocol implementations, read/write operations, and data parsing

pages.title: Channel Architecture
pages.purpose: Document IChannel interface, channel implementations (TCP/UDP/Serial), channel options, and connection lifecycle

pages.title: Data Handling and Transformation
pages.purpose: Describe DataHandlingAdapter, message parsing, ThingsGatewayBitConverter for endianness/format conversion, and WaitHandlePool for request-response correlation

pages.title: Core Utilities
pages.purpose: Document TimerX scheduling, ExpiringDictionary caching, WaitLock concurrency primitives, and Reflect utilities

pages.title: Gateway Application
pages.purpose: Explain the main gateway application layer that orchestrates device communication and data flow

pages.title: Runtime Management System
pages.purpose: Document the entity-to-runtime conversion, GlobalData static registry, RuntimeServiceHelper, and runtime synchronization

pages.title: Device Lifecycle Management
pages.purpose: Explain DeviceThreadManage, driver initialization, StartAsync/StopAsync lifecycle, TaskSchedulerLoop, and thread management

pages.title: Variable Management
pages.purpose: Document VariableRuntime, VariableSourceRead, variable packing optimization, and data collection workflow

pages.title: Concurrency and Read/Write Coordination
pages.purpose: Explain AsyncReadWriteLock, reader/writer priority, duty cycle control, and concurrent operation management

pages.title: Event System
pages.purpose: Document GlobalData event dispatchers, VariableValueChangeEvent, DeviceStatusChangeEvent, AlarmChangedEvent, and event flow

pages.title: Redundancy and Failover
pages.purpose: Explain device redundancy system, master/slave configuration, failover triggers, and variable state transfer

pages.title: Plugin Development
pages.purpose: Guide for developing custom plugins for data collection and business logic integration

pages.title: Collection Plugins (CollectBase)
pages.purpose: Document how to create data collection plugins including protocol implementation, variable loading, and scheduled tasks

pages.title: Business Plugins (BusinessBase)
pages.purpose: Explain business plugin development for data persistence, distribution, and serving protocols

pages.title: Plugin Service and Dynamic Loading
pages.purpose: Document PluginService, AssemblyLoadContext usage, plugin discovery, driver instantiation, and property configuration

pages.title: Plugin Packaging and Distribution
pages.purpose: Explain how to package plugins as NuGet packages, versioning, and deployment via Directory.build.targets

pages.title: Built-in Protocols
pages.purpose: Document the built-in protocol implementations including Modbus, Siemens S7, OPC UA, OPC DA, and Dlt645

pages.title: Modbus Protocol
pages.purpose: Document Modbus Master/Slave implementations, RTU/TCP/UDP support, function codes, and address parsing

pages.title: Siemens S7 Protocol
pages.purpose: Explain S7 Master implementation, PLC types, area addressing, and data block access
